questions.question: I ……………………… sure that she is lying.
questions.description: When feel is used to talk about reactions and opinions, it is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: They are ……………………… kind people!
questions.description: In exclamations, we use such before an adjective + plural noun.

questions.question: That was ……………………….. kind of you.
questions.description: So is used before an adjective.

questions.question: I ………………………. him to arrive at 3 o’clock.
questions.description: Before an object, wait and hope are followed by for.

questions.question: You should never steal someone ……………………….. ideas.
questions.description: Else has a possessive form – else’s.

questions.question: She was ………………………. anxious.
questions.description: Too is not used with much before an adjective.

questions.question: I have difficulty ……………………………. dates.
questions.description: Difficulty is followed by (in) + ing form.

questions.question: The whole village was ……………………….. water.
questions.description: We use under when something is covered by what is over it.

questions.question: I didn’t like this jacket ………………………., it is too large.
How do you …………………………. the vacuum cleaner?
If my grandmother had been alive, she ……………………….. 95 this year.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.
